member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_GLYPH_METRICS
member.summary: Specifies the metrics of an individual glyph.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: INT32 Specifies the X offset from the glyph origin to the left edge of the black box. The glyph origin is the current horizontal writing position. A negative value means the black box extends to the left of the origin (often true for lowercase italic 'f').
Type: UINT32 Specifies the X offset from the origin of the current glyph to the origin of the next glyph when writing horizontally.

Type: INT32 Specifies the X offset from the right edge of the black box to the origin of the next glyph when writing horizontally. The value is negative when the right edge of the black box overhangs the layout box.

Type: INT32 Specifies the vertical offset from the vertical origin to the top of the black box. Thus, a positive value adds whitespace whereas a negative value means the glyph overhangs the top of the layout box.

Type: UINT32 Specifies the Y offset from the vertical origin of the current glyph to the vertical origin of the next glyph when writing vertically. Note that the term "origin" by itself denotes the horizontal origin. The vertical origin is different. Its Y coordinate is specified by verticalOriginY value, and its X coordinate is half the advanceWidth to the right of the horizontal origin.

Type: INT32 Specifies the vertical distance from the bottom edge of the black box to the advance height. This is positive when the bottom edge of the black box is within the layout box, or negative when the bottom edge of black box overhangs the layout box.

Type: INT32 Specifies the Y coordinate of a glyph's vertical origin, in the font's design coordinate system. The y coordinate of a glyph's vertical origin is the sum of the glyph's top side bearing and the top (that is, yMax) of the glyph's bounding box.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_GLYPH_OFFSET
member.summary: The optional adjustment to a glyph's position.

remarks.para: An glyph offset changes the position of a glyph without affecting the pen position. Offsets are in logical, pre-transform units.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: FLOAT The offset in the advance direction of the run. A positive advance offset moves the glyph to the right (in pre-transform coordinates) if the run is left-to-right or to the left if the run is right-to-left.

Type: FLOAT The offset in the ascent direction, that is, the direction ascenders point. A positive ascender offset moves the glyph up (in pre-transform coordinates). A negative ascender offset moves the glyph down.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_GLYPH_RUN
member.summary: Contains the information needed by renderers to draw glyph runs.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: IDWriteFontFace* The physical font face object to draw with.
Type: FLOAT The logical size of the font in DIPs (equals 1/96 inch), not points.
Type: UINT32 The number of glyphs in the glyph run.
Type: const UINT16* A pointer to an array of indices to render for the glyph run.
Type: const FLOAT* A pointer to an array containing glyph advance widths for the glyph run.
Type: const DWRITE_GLYPH_OFFSET* A pointer to an array containing glyph offsets for the glyph run.

Type: BOOL If true, specifies that glyphs are rotated 90 degrees to the left and vertical metrics are used. Vertical writing is achieved by specifying isSideways = true and rotating the entire run 90 degrees to the right via a rotate transform.

Type: UINT32 The implicit resolved bidi level of the run. Odd levels indicate right-to-left languages like Hebrew and Arabic, while even levels indicate left-to-right languages like English and Japanese (when written horizontally). For right-to-left languages, the text origin is on the right, and text should be drawn to the left.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_GLYPH_RUN_DESCRIPTION
member.summary: Contains additional properties related to those in DWRITE_GLYPH_RUN.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: const WCHAR* An array of characters containing the locale name associated with this run.
Type: UINT32 The number of characters in UTF16 code-units. Note that this may be different than the number of glyphs.
Type: const UINT16* An array of indices to the glyph indices array, of the first glyphs of all the glyph clusters of the glyphs to render.
Type: UINT32 Corresponding text position in the string this glyph run came from. This is relative to the beginning of the string represented by the IDWriteTextLayout object.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_HIT_TEST_METRICS
member.summary: Describes the region obtained by a hit test.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: UINT32 The first text position within the hit region.
Type: UINT32 The number of text positions within the hit region.
Type: FLOAT The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the hit region.
Type: FLOAT The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the hit region.
Type: FLOAT The width of the hit region.
Type: FLOAT The height of the hit region.
Type: UINT32 The BIDI level of the text positions within the hit region.
Type: BOOL true if the hit region contains text; otherwise, false.
Type: BOOL true if the text range is trimmed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID
member.summary: The informational string enumeration which identifies a string embedded in a font file.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_NONE
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the unspecified name ID.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_COPYRIGHT_NOTICE
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the copyright notice provided by the font.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_VERSION_STRINGS
member.summary: Indicates the string containing a version number.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_TRADEMARK
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the trademark information provided by the font.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_MANUFACTURER
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the name of the font manufacturer.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_DESIGNER
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the name of the font designer.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_DESIGNER_URL
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the URL of the font designer (with protocol, e.g., http://, ftp://).

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_DESCRIPTION
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the description of the font. This may also contain revision information, usage recommendations, history, features, and so on.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_FONT_VENDOR_URL
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the URL of the font vendor (with protocol, e.g., http://, ftp://). If a unique serial number is embedded in the URL, it can be used to register the font.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_LICENSE_DESCRIPTION
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the description of how the font may be legally used, or different example scenarios for licensed use.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_LICENSE_INFO_URL
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the URL where additional licensing information can be found.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_WIN32_FAMILY_NAMES
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the GDI-compatible family name. Since GDI allows a maximum of four fonts per family, fonts in the same family may have different GDI-compatible family names (e.g., "Arial", "Arial Narrow", "Arial Black").

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_WIN32_SUBFAMILY_NAMES
member.summary: Indicates the string containing a GDI-compatible subfamily name.

summary.para: Contains sample text for display in font lists. This can be the font name or any other text that the designer thinks is the best example to display the font in.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_FULL_NAME
member.summary: The full name of the font, like Arial Bold, from name id 4 in the name table

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_POSTSCRIPT_NAME
member.summary: The postscript name of the font, like GillSans-Bold, from name id 6 in the name table.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_POSTSCRIPT_CID_NAME
member.summary: The postscript CID findfont name, from name id 20 in the name table

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_PREFERRED_FAMILY_NAMES
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the family name preferred by the designer. This enables font designers to group more than four fonts in a single family without losing compatibility with GDI. This name is typically only present if it differs from the GDI-compatible family name.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_ID.DWRITE_INFORMATIONAL_STRING_PREFERRED_SUBFAMILY_NAMES
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the subfamily name preferred by the designer. This name is typically only present if it differs from the GDI-compatible subfamily name.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INLINE_OBJECT_METRICS
member.summary: Contains properties describing the geometric measurement of an application-defined inline object.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: FLOAT The width of the inline object.
Type: FLOAT The height of the inline object.
Type: FLOAT The distance from the top of the object to the point where it is lined up with the adjacent text. If the baseline is at the bottom, then baseline simply equals height.
Type: BOOL A Boolean flag that indicates whether the object is to be placed upright or alongside the text baseline for vertical text.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_LINE_BREAKPOINT
member.summary: Line breakpoint characteristics of a character.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_LINE_METRICS
member.summary: Contains information about a formatted line of text.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: UINT32 The number of text positions in the text line. This includes any trailing whitespace and newline characters.
Type: UINT32 The number of whitespace positions at the end of the text line. Newline sequences are considered whitespace.
Type: UINT32 The number of characters in the newline sequence at the end of the text line. If the count is zero, then the text line was either wrapped or it is the end of the text.
Type: FLOAT The height of the text line.
Type: FLOAT The distance from the top of the text line to its baseline.
Type: BOOL The line is trimmed.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_LINE_SPACING_METHOD
member.summary: The method used for line spacing in a text layout.

remarks.para: The line spacing method is set by using the SetLineSpacing method of the IDWriteTextFormat or IDWriteTextLayout interfaces. To get the current line spacing method of a text format or text layou use the GetLineSpacing.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_LINE_SPACING_METHOD.DWRITE_LINE_SPACING_METHOD_DEFAULT
member.summary: Line spacing depends solely on the content, adjusting to accommodate the size of fonts and inline objects.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_LINE_SPACING_METHOD.DWRITE_LINE_SPACING_METHOD_UNIFORM
member.summary: Lines are explicitly set to uniform spacing, regardless of the size of fonts and inline objects. This can be useful to avoid the uneven appearance that can occur from font fallback.

summary.para: Line spacing and baseline distances are proportional to the computed values based on the content, the size of the fonts and inline objects.

para.div: Note This value is only available on Windows 10 or later and it can be used with IDWriteTextLayout3::SetLineSpacing, but can not be used with IDWriteTextFormat::SetLineSpacing.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_MATRIX
member.summary: The DWRITE_MATRIX structure specifies the graphics transform to be applied to rendered glyphs.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: FLOAT A value indicating the horizontal scaling / cosine of rotation.
Type: FLOAT A value indicating the vertical shear / sine of rotation.
Type: FLOAT A value indicating the horizontal shear / negative sine of rotation.
Type: FLOAT A value indicating the vertical scaling / cosine of rotation.
Type: FLOAT A value indicating the horizontal shift (always orthogonal regardless of rotation).
Type: FLOAT A value indicating the vertical shift (always orthogonal regardless of rotation.)

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE
member.summary: Indicates the measuring method used for text layout.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE.DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE_NATURAL
member.summary: Specifies that text is measured using glyph ideal metrics whose values are independent to the current display resolution.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE.DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE_GDI_CLASSIC
member.summary: Specifies that text is measured using glyph display-compatible metrics whose values tuned for the current display resolution.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE.DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE_GDI_NATURAL
member.summary: Specifies that text is measured using the same glyph display metrics as text measured by GDI using a font created with CLEARTYPE_NATURAL_QUALITY.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD
member.summary: Specifies how to apply number substitution on digits and related punctuation.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD_FROM_CULTURE
member.summary: Specifies that the substitution method should be determined based on the LOCALE_IDIGITSUBSTITUTION value of the specified text culture.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD_CONTEXTUAL
member.summary: If the culture is Arabic or Persian, specifies that the number shapes depend on the context. Either traditional or nominal number shapes are used, depending on the nearest preceding strong character or (if there is none) the reading direction of the paragraph.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD_NONE
member.summary: Specifies that code points 0x30-0x39 are always rendered as nominal numeral shapes (ones of the European number), that is, no substitution is performed.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD_NATIONAL
member.summary: Specifies that numbers are rendered using the national number shapes as specified by the LOCALE_SNATIVEDIGITS value of the specified text culture.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD.DWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD_TRADITIONAL
member.summary: Specifies that numbers are rendered using the traditional shapes for the specified culture. For most cultures, this is the same as NativeNational. However, NativeNational results in Latin numbers for some Arabic cultures, whereasDWRITE_NUMBER_SUBSTITUTION_METHOD_TRADITIONAL results in arabic numbers for all Arabic cultures.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_OVERHANG_METRICS
member.summary: Indicates how much any visible DIPs (device independent pixels) overshoot each side of the layout or inline objects.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: FLOAT The distance from the left-most visible DIP to its left-alignment edge.
Type: FLOAT The distance from the top-most visible DIP to its top alignment edge.
Type: FLOAT The distance from the right-most visible DIP to its right-alignment edge.
Type: FLOAT The distance from the bottom-most visible DIP to its lower-alignment edge.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_PARAGRAPH_ALIGNMENT
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of paragraph text along the flow direction axis, relative to the top and bottom of the flow's layout box.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_PARAGRAPH_ALIGNMENT.DWRITE_PARAGRAPH_ALIGNMENT_NEAR
member.summary: The top of the text flow is aligned to the top edge of the layout box.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_PARAGRAPH_ALIGNMENT.DWRITE_PARAGRAPH_ALIGNMENT_FAR
member.summary: The bottom of the text flow is aligned to the bottom edge of the layout box.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_PARAGRAPH_ALIGNMENT.DWRITE_PARAGRAPH_ALIGNMENT_CENTER
member.summary: The center of the flow is aligned to the center of the layout box.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_PIXEL_GEOMETRY
member.summary: Represents the internal structure of a device pixel (that is, the physical arrangement of red, green, and blue color components) that is assumed for purposes of rendering text.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_PIXEL_GEOMETRY.DWRITE_PIXEL_GEOMETRY_FLAT
member.summary: The red, green, and blue color components of each pixel are assumed to occupy the same point.

summary.para: Each pixel is composed of three vertical stripes, with red on the left, green in the center, and blue on the right. This is the most common pixel geometry for LCD monitors.
Each pixel is composed of three vertical stripes, with blue on the left, green in the center, and red on the right.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_READING_DIRECTION
member.summary: Specifies the direction in which reading progresses.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_READING_DIRECTION.DWRITE_READING_DIRECTION_LEFT_TO_RIGHT
member.summary: Indicates that reading progresses from left to right.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_READING_DIRECTION.DWRITE_READING_DIRECTION_RIGHT_TO_LEFT
member.summary: Indicates that reading progresses from right to left.

summary.para:
Note Windows 8.1 and later only.
Indicates that reading progresses from top to bottom.

Note Windows 8.1 and later only.
Indicates that reading progresses from bottom to top.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE
member.summary: Represents a method of rendering glyphs.

para.pre: enum DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE { DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_DEFAULT, DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_ALIASED, DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_CLEARTYPE_GDI_CLASSIC, DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_CLEARTYPE_GDI_NATURAL, DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_CLEARTYPE_NATURAL, DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_CLEARTYPE_NATURAL_SYMMETRIC, DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_OUTLINE };

remarks.para: Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE.DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_DEFAULT
member.summary: Specifies that the rendering mode is determined automatically, based on the font and size.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE.DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_ALIASED
member.summary: Specifies that no anti-aliasing is performed. Each pixel is either set to the foreground color of the text or retains the color of the background.

summary.para: Specifies that antialiasing is performed in the horizontal direction and the appearance of glyphs is layout-compatible with GDI using CLEARTYPE_QUALITY. Use DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE_GDI_CLASSIC to get glyph advances. The antialiasing may be either ClearType or grayscale depending on the text antialiasing mode.

Specifies that antialiasing is performed in the horizontal direction and the appearance of glyphs is layout-compatible with GDI using CLEARTYPE_NATURAL_QUALITY. Glyph advances are close to the font design advances, but are still rounded to whole pixels. Use DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE_GDI_NATURAL to get glyph advances. The antialiasing may be either ClearType or grayscale depending on the text antialiasing mode.

Specifies that antialiasing is performed in the horizontal direction. This rendering mode allows glyphs to be positioned with subpixel precision and is therefore suitable for natural (i.e., resolution-independent) layout. The antialiasing may be either ClearType or grayscale depending on the text antialiasing mode.

Similar to natural mode except that antialiasing is performed in both the horizontal and vertical directions. This is typically used at larger sizes to make curves and diagonal lines look smoother. The antialiasing may be either ClearType or grayscale depending on the text antialiasing mode.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE.DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_OUTLINE
member.summary: Specifies that rendering should bypass the rasterizer and use the outlines directly. This is typically used at very large sizes.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_SCRIPT_ANALYSIS
member.summary: Stores the association of text and its writing system script, as well as some display attributes.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: UINT16 The zero-based index representation of writing system script.
Type: DWRITE_SCRIPT_SHAPES A value that indicates additional shaping requirement of text.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_SCRIPT_SHAPES
member.summary: Indicates additional shaping requirements for text.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_SCRIPT_SHAPES.DWRITE_SCRIPT_SHAPES_DEFAULT
member.summary: Indicates that there is no additional shaping requirements for text. Text is shaped with the writing system default behavior.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_SCRIPT_SHAPES.DWRITE_SCRIPT_SHAPES_NO_VISUAL
member.summary: Indicates that text should leave no visible control or format control characters.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_SHAPING_GLYPH_PROPERTIES
member.summary: Contains shaping output properties for an output glyph.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_SHAPING_TEXT_PROPERTIES
member.summary: Shaping output properties for an output glyph.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_STRIKETHROUGH
member.summary: Contains information regarding the size and placement of strikethroughs.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the width of the strikethrough, measured parallel to the baseline.
Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the thickness of the strikethrough, measured perpendicular to the baseline.

Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the offset of the strikethrough from the baseline. A positive offset represents a position below the baseline and a negative offset is above. Typically, the offset will be negative.
Type: DWRITE_READING_DIRECTION Reading direction of the text associated with the strikethrough. This value is used to interpret whether the width value runs horizontally or vertically.

Type: DWRITE_FLOW_DIRECTION Flow direction of the text associated with the strikethrough. This value is used to interpret whether the thickness value advances top to bottom, left to right, or right to left.
Type: const WCHAR* An array of characters containing the locale of the text that is the strikethrough is being drawn over.
Type: DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE The measuring mode can be useful to the renderer to determine how underlines are rendered, such as rounding the thickness to a whole pixel in GDI-compatible modes.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXTURE_TYPE
member.summary: Identifies a type of alpha texture.

remarks.para: An alpha texture is a bitmap of alpha values, each representing opacity of a pixel or subpixel.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXTURE_TYPE.DWRITE_TEXTURE_ALIASED_1x1
member.summary: Specifies an alpha texture for aliased text rendering (that is, each pixel is either fully opaque or fully transparent), with one byte per pixel.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXTURE_TYPE.DWRITE_TEXTURE_CLEARTYPE_3x1
member.summary: Specifies an alpha texture for ClearType text rendering, with three bytes per pixel in the horizontal dimension and one byte per pixel in the vertical dimension.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of paragraph text along the reading direction axis, relative to the leading and trailing edge of the layout box.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT.DWRITE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT_LEADING
member.summary: The leading edge of the paragraph text is aligned to the leading edge of the layout box.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT.DWRITE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT_TRAILING
member.summary: The trailing edge of the paragraph text is aligned to the trailing edge of the layout box.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT.DWRITE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT_CENTER
member.summary: The center of the paragraph text is aligned to the center of the layout box.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT.DWRITE_TEXT_ALIGNMENT_JUSTIFIED
member.summary: Align text to the leading side, and also justify text to fill the lines.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXT_METRICS
member.summary: Contains the metrics associated with text after layout.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the left-most point of formatted text relative to the layout box, while excluding any glyph overhang.
Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the top-most point of formatted text relative to the layout box, while excluding any glyph overhang.
Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the width of the formatted text, while ignoring trailing whitespace at the end of each line.
Type: FLOAT The width of the formatted text, taking into account the trailing whitespace at the end of each line.
Type: FLOAT The height of the formatted text. The height of an empty string is set to the same value as that of the default font.
Type: FLOAT The initial width given to the layout. It can be either larger or smaller than the text content width, depending on whether the text was wrapped.
Type: FLOAT Initial height given to the layout. Depending on the length of the text, it may be larger or smaller than the text content height.

Type: UINT32 The maximum reordering count of any line of text, used to calculate the most number of hit-testing boxes needed. If the layout has no bidirectional text, or no text at all, the minimum level is 1.
Type: UINT32 Total number of lines.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXT_RANGE
member.summary: Specifies a range of text positions where format is applied in the text represented by an IDWriteTextLayout object.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: UINT32 The start position of the text range.
Type: UINT32 The number positions in the text range.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TRIMMING
member.summary: Specifies the trimming option for text overflowing the layout box.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: DWRITE_TRIMMING_GRANULARITY A value that specifies the text granularity used to trim text overflowing the layout box.

Type: UINT32 A character code used as the delimiter that signals the beginning of the portion of text to be preserved. Text starting from the Nth occurence of the delimiter (where N equals delimiterCount) counting backwards from the end of the text block will be preserved. For example, given the text is a path like c:\A\B\C\D\file.txt and delimiter equal to '\' and delimiterCount equal to 1, the file.txt portion of the text would be preserved. Specifying a delimiterCount of 2 would preserve D\file.txt.
Type: UINT32 The delimiter count, counting from the end of the text, to preserve text from.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TRIMMING_GRANULARITY
member.summary: Specifies the text granularity used to trim text overflowing the layout box.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TRIMMING_GRANULARITY.DWRITE_TRIMMING_GRANULARITY_NONE
member.summary: No trimming occurs. Text flows beyond the layout width.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TRIMMING_GRANULARITY.DWRITE_TRIMMING_GRANULARITY_CHARACTER
member.summary: Trimming occurs at a character cluster boundary.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TRIMMING_GRANULARITY.DWRITE_TRIMMING_GRANULARITY_WORD
member.summary: Trimming occurs at a word boundary.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TYPOGRAPHIC_FEATURES
member.summary: Contains a set of typographic features to be applied during text shaping.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: DWRITE_FONT_FEATURE* A pointer to a structure that specifies properties used to identify and execute typographic features in the font.
Type: UINT32 A value that indicates the number of features being applied to a font face.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_UNDERLINE
member.summary: Contains information about the width, thickness, offset, run height, reading direction, and flow direction of an underline.

remarks.para: All coordinates are in device independent pixels (DIPs).
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the width of the underline, measured parallel to the baseline.
Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the thickness of the underline, measured perpendicular to the baseline.

Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the offset of the underline from the baseline. A positive offset represents a position below the baseline (away from the text) and a negative offset is above (toward the text).
Type: FLOAT A value that indicates the height of the tallest run where the underline is applied.

Type: DWRITE_READING_DIRECTION A value that indicates the reading direction of the text associated with the underline. This value is used to interpret whether the width value runs horizontally or vertically.

Type: DWRITE_FLOW_DIRECTION A value that indicates the flow direction of the text associated with the underline. This value is used to interpret whether the thickness value advances top to bottom, left to right, or right to left.

Type: const WCHAR* An array of characters which contains the locale of the text that the underline is being drawn under. For example, in vertical text, the underline belongs on the left for Chinese but on the right for Japanese.
Type: DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE The measuring mode can be useful to the renderer to determine how underlines are rendered, such as rounding the thickness to a whole pixel in GDI-compatible modes.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING
member.summary: Specifies the word wrapping to be used in a particular multiline paragraph.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_WRAP
member.summary: Indicates that words are broken across lines to avoid text overflowing the layout box.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_NO_WRAP
member.summary: Indicates that words are kept within the same line even when it overflows the layout box. This option is often used with scrolling to reveal overflow text.

summary.para:
Note Windows 8.1 and later only.
Words are broken across lines to avoid text overflowing the layout box. Emergency wrapping occurs if the word is larger than the maximum width.

Note Windows 8.1 and later only.
When emergency wrapping, only wrap whole words, never breaking words when the layout width is too small for even a single word.

Note Windows 8.1 and later only.
Wrap between any valid character clusters.

member.summary: Draws a run of glyphs to a bitmap target at the specified position.

param.name: baselineOriginX
param.para: Type: FLOAT The horizontal position of the baseline origin, in DIPs, relative to the upper-left corner of the DIB.

param.name: baselineOriginY
param.para: Type: FLOAT The vertical position of the baseline origin, in DIPs, relative to the upper-left corner of the DIB.

param.name: measuringMode
param.para: Type: DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE The measuring method for glyphs in the run, used with the other properties to determine the rendering mode.

param.name: glyphRun
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_GLYPH_RUN* The structure containing the properties of the glyph run.

param.name: renderingParams
param.para: Type: IDWriteRenderingParams* The object that controls rendering behavior.

param.name: textColor
param.para: Type: COLORREF The foreground color of the text.

param.name: blackBoxRect
param.para: Type: RECT* The optional rectangle that receives the bounding box (in pixels not DIPs) of all the pixels affected by drawing the glyph run. The black box rectangle may extend beyond the dimensions of the bitmap.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFactory.GetSystemFontCollection(Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontCollection@,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL)
member.summary: Gets an object which represents the set of installed fonts.

param.name: fontCollection
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontCollection** When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the system font collection object, or NULL in case of failure.

param.name: checkForUpdates
param.para: Type: BOOL If this parameter is nonzero, the function performs an immediate check for changes to the set of installed fonts. If this parameter is FALSE, the function will still detect changes if the font cache service is running, but there may be some latency. For example, an application might specify TRUE if it has itself just installed a font and wants to be sure the font collection contains that font.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFactory.CreateCustomFontCollection(Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontCollectionLoader,System.Void*,System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontCollection@)
member.summary: Creates a font collection using a custom font collection loader.

param.name: collectionLoader
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontCollectionLoader* An application-defined font collection loader, which must have been previously registered using RegisterFontCollectionLoader.

param.name: collectionKey
param.para: Type: const void* The key used by the loader to identify a collection of font files. The buffer allocated for this key should at least be the size of collectionKeySize.

param.name: collectionKeySize
param.para: Type: UINT32 The size, in bytes, of the collection key.

param.name: fontCollection
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontCollection** Contains an address of a pointer to the system font collection object if the method succeeds, or NULL in case of failure.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Registers a custom font collection loader with the factory object.

param.para: Type: IDWriteFontCollectionLoader* Pointer to a IDWriteFontCollectionLoader object to be registered.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Unregisters a custom font collection loader that was previously registered using RegisterFontCollectionLoader.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFactory.CreateFontFileReference(Windows.Win32.Foundation.PCWSTR,System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FILETIME*,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFile@)
member.summary: Creates a font file reference object from a local font file.

param.name: filePath
param.para: Type: const WCHAR* An array of characters that contains the absolute file path for the font file. Subsequent operations on the constructed object may fail if the user provided filePath doesn't correspond to a valid file on the disk.

param.name: lastWriteTime
param.para: Type: const FILETIME* The last modified time of the input file path. If the parameter is omitted, the function will access the font file to obtain its last write time. You should specify this value to avoid extra disk access. Subsequent operations on the constructed object may fail if the user provided lastWriteTime doesn't match the file on the disk.

param.name: fontFile
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontFile** When this method returns, contains an address of a pointer to the newly created font file reference object, or NULL in case of failure.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFactory.CreateCustomFontFileReference(System.Void*,System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFileLoader,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFile@)
member.summary: Creates a reference to an application-specific font file resource.

param.name: fontFileReferenceKey
param.para: Type: const void* A font file reference key that uniquely identifies the font file resource during the lifetime of fontFileLoader.

param.name: fontFileReferenceKeySize
param.para: Type: UINT32 The size of the font file reference key in bytes.

param.name: fontFileLoader
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontFileLoader* The font file loader that will be used by the font system to load data from the file identified by fontFileReferenceKey.

param.name: fontFile
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontFile** Contains an address of a pointer to the newly created font file object when this method succeeds, or NULL in case of failure.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Creates an object that represents a font face.

param.name: fontFaceType
param.para: Type: DWRITE_FONT_FACE_TYPE A value that indicates the type of file format of the font face.

param.name: numberOfFiles
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of font files, in element count, required to represent the font face.

param.name: fontFiles
param.para: Type: const IDWriteFontFile* A font file object representing the font face. Because IDWriteFontFacemaintains its own references to the input font file objects, you may release them after this call.

param.name: faceIndex
param.para: Type: UINT32 The zero-based index of a font face, in cases when the font files contain a collection of font faces. If the font files contain a single face, this value should be zero.

param.name: fontFaceSimulationFlags
param.para: Type: DWRITE_FONT_SIMULATIONS A value that indicates which, if any, font face simulation flags for algorithmic means of making text bold or italic are applied to the current font face.

param.name: fontFace
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontFace** When this method returns, contains an address of a pointer to the newly created font face object, or NULL in case of failure.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Creates a text format object used for text layout.

param.para: Type: IDWriteTextFormat** When this method returns, contains an address of a pointer to a newly created text format object, or NULL in case of failure.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: Takes a string, text format, and associated constraints, and produces an object that represents the fully analyzed and formatted result.

param.name: maxWidth

param.name: maxHeight
param.para: Type: FLOAT The height of the layout box.

param.name: textLayout
param.para: Type: IDWriteTextLayout** When this method returns, contains an address of a pointer to the resultant text layout object.

member.summary: Takes a string, format, and associated constraints, and produces an object representing the result, formatted for a particular display resolution and measuring mode.

param.name: stringLength
param.para: Type: UINT32 The length of the string, in character count.

param.name: textFormat
param.para: Type: IDWriteTextFormat* The text formatting object to apply to the string.

param.name: layoutWidth
param.para: Type: FLOAT The width of the layout box.

param.name: layoutHeight
param.para: Type: FLOAT The height of the layout box.

param.name: pixelsPerDip
param.para: Type: FLOAT The number of physical pixels per DIP (device independent pixel). For example, if rendering onto a 96 DPI device pixelsPerDipis 1. If rendering onto a 120 DPI device pixelsPerDip is 1.25 (120/96).

param.name: transform
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_MATRIX* An optional transform applied to the glyphs and their positions. This transform is applied after the scaling specifies the font size and pixels per DIP.

param.name: useGdiNatural
param.para: Type: BOOL Instructs the text layout to use the same metrics as GDI bi-level text when set to FALSE. When set to TRUE, instructs the text layout to use the same metrics as text measured by GDI using a font created with CLEARTYPE_NATURAL_QUALITY.

param.name: textLayout
param.para: Type: IDWriteTextLayout** When this method returns, contains an address to the pointer of the resultant text layout object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Creates a glyph run analysis object, which encapsulates information used to render a glyph run.

param.name: glyphRun
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_GLYPH_RUN* A structure that contains the properties of the glyph run (font face, advances, and so on).

param.name: pixelsPerDip
param.para: Type: FLOAT Number of physical pixels per DIP (device independent pixel). For example, if rendering onto a 96 DPI bitmap then pixelsPerDipis 1. If rendering onto a 120 DPI bitmap then pixelsPerDip is 1.25.

param.name: transform
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_MATRIX* Optional transform applied to the glyphs and their positions. This transform is applied after the scaling specified the emSize and pixelsPerDip.

param.name: renderingMode
param.para: Type: DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE A value that specifies the rendering mode, which must be one of the raster rendering modes (that is, not default and not outline).

param.name: measuringMode
param.para: Type: DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE Specifies the measuring mode to use with glyphs.

param.name: baselineOriginX
param.para: Type: FLOAT The horizontal position (X-coordinate) of the baseline origin, in DIPs.

param.name: baselineOriginY
param.para: Type: FLOAT Vertical position (Y-coordinate) of the baseline origin, in DIPs.

param.name: glyphRunAnalysis
param.para: Type: IDWriteGlyphRunAnalysis** When this method returns, contains an address of a pointer to the newly created glyph run analysis object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Obtains the font files representing a font face.

param.para: Type: UINT32* If fontFiles is NULL, receives the number of files representing the font face. Otherwise, the number of font files being requested should be passed. See the Remarks section below for more information.

param.name: fontFiles
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontFile** When this method returns, contains a pointer to a user-provided array that stores pointers to font files representing the font face. This parameter can be NULL if the user wants only the number of files representing the font face. This API increments reference count of the font file pointers returned according to COM conventions, and the client should release them when finished.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: Obtains design units and common metrics for the font face. These metrics are applicable to all the glyphs within a font face and are used by applications for layout calculations.

param.name: fontFaceMetrics
param.para: Type: DWRITE_FONT_METRICS* When this method returns, a DWRITE_FONT_METRICS structure that holds metrics (such as ascent, descent, or cap height) for the current font face element. The metrics returned by this function are in font design units.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFace.GetGlyphCount
member.summary: Obtains the number of glyphs in the font face.

returns.para: Type: UINT16 The number of glyphs in the font face.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFace.GetDesignGlyphMetrics(System.UInt16*,System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_GLYPH_METRICS*,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL)
member.summary: Obtains ideal (resolution-independent) glyph metrics in font design units.

param.name: glyphIndices
param.para: Type: const UINT16* An array of glyph indices for which to compute metrics. The array must contain at least as many elements as specified by glyphCount.

param.name: glyphCount
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of elements in the glyphIndices array.

param.name: glyphMetrics
param.para: Type: DWRITE_GLYPH_METRICS* When this method returns, contains an array of DWRITE_GLYPH_METRICS structures. glyphMetrics must be initialized with an empty buffer that contains at least as many elements as glyphCount. The metrics returned by this function are in font design units.

param.name: isSideways
param.para: Type: BOOL Indicates whether the font is being used in a sideways run. This can affect the glyph metrics if the font has oblique simulation because sideways oblique simulation differs from non-sideways oblique simulation

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFace.GetGlyphIndices(System.UInt32*,System.UInt32,System.UInt16*)
member.summary: Returns the nominal mapping of UCS4 Unicode code points to glyph indices as defined by the font 'CMAP' table.

param.name: codePoints
param.para: Type: const UINT32* An array of USC4 code points from which to obtain nominal glyph indices. The array must be allocated and be able to contain the number of elements specified by codePointCount.

param.name: codePointCount
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of elements in the codePoints array.

param.name: glyphIndices
param.para: Type: UINT16* When this method returns, contains a pointer to an array of nominal glyph indices filled by this function.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFace.TryGetFontTable(System.UInt32,System.Void**,System.UInt32*,System.Void**,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL*)
member.summary: Finds the specified OpenType font table if it exists and returns a pointer to it. The function accesses the underlying font data through the IDWriteFontFileStream interface implemented by the font file loader.

param.name: openTypeTableTag
param.para: Type: UINT32 The four-character tag of a OpenType font table to find. Use the DWRITE_MAKE_OPENTYPE_TAG macro to create it as an UINT32. Unlike GDI, it does not support the special TTCF and null tags to access the whole font.

param.name: tableData
param.para: Type: const void** When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the base of the table in memory. The pointer is valid only as long as the font face used to get the font table still exists; (not any other font face, even if it actually refers to the same physical font). This parameter is passed uninitialized.

param.name: tableSize
param.para: Type: UINT32* When this method returns, contains a pointer to the size, in bytes, of the font table.

param.name: tableContext
param.para: Type: void** When this method returns, the address of a pointer to the opaque context, which must be freed by calling ReleaseFontTable. The context actually comes from the lower-level IDWriteFontFileStream, which may be implemented by the application or DWrite itself. It is possible for a NULL tableContext to be returned, especially if the implementation performs direct memory mapping on the whole file. Nevertheless, always release it later, and do not use it as a test for function success. The same table can be queried multiple times, but because each returned context can be different, you must release each context separately.

param.name: exists
param.para: Type: BOOL* When this method returns, TRUE if the font table exists; otherwise, FALSE.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFace.ReleaseFontTable(System.Void*)
member.summary: Releases the table obtained earlier from TryGetFontTable.

param.name: tableContext
param.para: Type: void* A pointer to the opaque context from TryGetFontTable.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Computes the outline of a run of glyphs by calling back to the outline sink interface.

param.name: emSize
param.para: Type: FLOAT The logical size of the font in DIP units. A DIP ("device-independent pixel") equals 1/96 inch.

param.name: glyphIndices
param.para: Type: const UINT16* An array of glyph indices. The glyphs are in logical order and the advance direction depends on the isRightToLeft parameter. The array must be allocated and be able to contain the number of elements specified by glyphCount.

param.name: glyphAdvances
param.para: Type: const FLOAT* An optional array of glyph advances in DIPs. The advance of a glyph is the amount to advance the position (in the direction of the baseline) after drawing the glyph. glyphAdvances contains the number of elements specified by glyphCount.

param.name: glyphOffsets
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_GLYPH_OFFSET* An optional array of glyph offsets, each of which specifies the offset along the baseline and offset perpendicular to the baseline of a glyph relative to the current pen position. glyphOffsets contains the number of elements specified by glyphCount.

param.name: glyphCount
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of glyphs in the run.

param.name: isSideways
param.para: Type: BOOL If TRUE, the ascender of the glyph runs alongside the baseline. If FALSE, the glyph ascender runs perpendicular to the baseline. For example, an English alphabet on a vertical baseline would have isSideways set to FALSE. A client can render a vertical run by setting isSideways to TRUE and rotating the resulting geometry 90 degrees to the right using a transform. The isSideways and isRightToLeft parameters cannot both be true.

param.name: isRightToLeft
param.para: Type: BOOL The visual order of the glyphs. If this parameter is FALSE, then glyph advances are from left to right. If TRUE, the advance direction is right to left. By default, the advance direction is left to right.

param.name: geometrySink
param.para: Type: IDWriteGeometrySink* A pointer to the interface that is called back to perform outline drawing operations.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFace.GetRecommendedRenderingMode(System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteRenderingParams,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE*)
member.summary: Determines the recommended rendering mode for the font, using the specified size and rendering parameters.

param.name: emSize
param.para: Type: FLOAT The logical size of the font in DIP units. A DIP ("device-independent pixel") equals 1/96 inch.

param.name: pixelsPerDip
param.para: Type: FLOAT The number of physical pixels per DIP. For example, if the DPI of the rendering surface is 96, this value is 1.0f. If the DPI is 120, this value is 120.0f/96.

param.name: measuringMode
param.para: Type: DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE The measuring method that will be used for glyphs in the font. Renderer implementations may choose different rendering modes for different measuring methods, for example:

param.name: renderingParams
param.para: Type: IDWriteRenderingParams* A pointer to an object that contains rendering settings such as gamma level, enhanced contrast, and ClearType level. This parameter is necessary in case the rendering parameters object overrides the rendering mode.

param.name: renderingMode
param.para: Type: DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE* When this method returns, contains a value that indicates the recommended rendering mode to use.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFace.GetGdiCompatibleMetrics(System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_MATRIX*,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_FONT_METRICS*)
member.summary: Obtains design units and common metrics for the font face. These metrics are applicable to all the glyphs within a fontface and are used by applications for layout calculations.

param.name: emSize
param.para: Type: FLOAT The logical size of the font in DIP units.

param.name: pixelsPerDip
param.para: Type: FLOAT The number of physical pixels per DIP.

param.name: transform
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_MATRIX* An optional transform applied to the glyphs and their positions. This transform is applied after the scaling specified by the font size and pixelsPerDip.

param.name: fontFaceMetrics
param.para: Type: DWRITE_FONT_METRICS* A pointer to a DWRITE_FONT_METRICS structure to fill in. The metrics returned by this function are in font design units.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT Standard HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Obtains glyph metrics in font design units with the return values compatible with what GDI would produce.

param.name: emSize
param.para: Type: FLOAT The ogical size of the font in DIP units.

param.name: pixelsPerDip
param.para: Type: FLOAT The number of physical pixels per DIP.

param.name: transform
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_MATRIX* An optional transform applied to the glyphs and their positions. This transform is applied after the scaling specified by the font size and pixelsPerDip.

param.name: useGdiNatural
param.para: Type: BOOL When set to FALSE, the metrics are the same as the metrics of GDI aliased text. When set to TRUE, the metrics are the same as the metrics of text measured by GDI using a font created with CLEARTYPE_NATURAL_QUALITY.

param.name: glyphIndices
param.para: Type: const UINT16* An array of glyph indices for which to compute the metrics.

param.name: glyphCount
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of elements in the glyphIndices array.

param.name: glyphMetrics
param.para: Type: DWRITE_GLYPH_METRICS* An array of DWRITE_GLYPH_METRICS structures filled by this function. The metrics are in font design units.

param.name: isSideways
param.para: Type: BOOL A BOOL value that indicates whether the font is being used in a sideways run. This can affect the glyph metrics if the font has oblique simulation because sideways oblique simulation differs from non-sideways oblique simulation.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT Standard HRESULT error code. If any of the input glyph indices are outside of the valid glyph index range for the current font face, E_INVALIDARG will be returned.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteGdiInterop.CreateFontFaceFromHdc(Windows.Win32.Graphics.Gdi.HDC,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteFontFace@)
member.summary: Creates an IDWriteFontFace object that corresponds to the currently selected HFONT of the specified HDC.

param.name: hdc
param.para: Type: HDC A handle to a device context into which a font has been selected. It is assumed that the client has already performed font mapping and that the font selected into the device context is the actual font to be used for rendering glyphs.

param.name: fontFace
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontFace** Contains an address of a pointer to the newly created font face object, or NULL in case of failure. The font face returned is guaranteed to reference the same physical typeface that would be used for drawing glyphs (but not necessarily characters) using ExtTextOut.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteGdiInterop.CreateBitmapRenderTarget(Windows.Win32.Graphics.Gdi.HDC,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteBitmapRenderTarget@)
member.summary: Creates an object that encapsulates a bitmap and memory DC (device context) which can be used for rendering glyphs.

param.name: hdc
param.para: Type: HDC A handle to the optional device context used to create a compatible memory DC (device context).

param.name: width
param.para: Type: UINT32 The width of the bitmap render target.

param.name: height
param.para: Type: UINT32 The height of the bitmap render target.

param.name: renderTarget
param.para: Type: IDWriteBitmapRenderTarget** When this method returns, contains an address of a pointer to the newly created IDWriteBitmapRenderTarget object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteGlyphRunAnalysis.GetAlphaTextureBounds(Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXTURE_TYPE,Windows.Win32.Foundation.RECT*)
member.summary: Gets the bounding rectangle of the physical pixels affected by the glyph run.

param.name: textureType
param.para: Type: DWRITE_TEXTURE_TYPE Specifies the type of texture requested. If a bi-level texture is requested, the bounding rectangle includes only bi-level glyphs. Otherwise, the bounding rectangle includes only antialiased glyphs.

param.name: textureBounds
param.para: Type: RECT* When this method returns, contains the bounding rectangle of the physical pixels affected by the glyph run, or an empty rectangle if there are no glyphs of the specified texture type.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteGlyphRunAnalysis.CreateAlphaTexture(Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_TEXTURE_TYPE,Windows.Win32.Foundation.RECT*,System.Byte*,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates an alpha texture of the specified type for glyphs within a specified bounding rectangle.

param.name: textureType
param.para: Type: DWRITE_TEXTURE_TYPE A value that specifies the type of texture requested. This can be DWRITE_TEXTURE_BILEVEL_1x1 or DWRITE_TEXTURE_CLEARTYPE_3x1. If a bi-level texture is requested, the texture contains only bi-level glyphs. Otherwise, the texture contains only antialiased glyphs.

param.name: textureBounds
param.para: Type: const RECT* The bounding rectangle of the texture, which can be different than the bounding rectangle returned by GetAlphaTextureBounds.

param.name: alphaValues
param.para: Type: BYTE* When this method returns, contains the array of alpha values from the texture. The buffer allocated for this array must be at least the size of bufferSize.

param.name: bufferSize
param.para: Type: UINT32 The size of the alphaValues array, in bytes. The minimum size depends on the dimensions of the rectangle and the type of texture requested.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteGlyphRunAnalysis.GetAlphaBlendParams(Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteRenderingParams,System.Single*,System.Single*,System.Single*)
member.summary: Gets alpha blending properties required for ClearType blending.

param.name: renderingParams
param.para: Type: IDWriteRenderingParams* An object that specifies the ClearType level and enhanced contrast, gamma, pixel geometry, and rendering mode. In most cases, the values returned by the output parameters of this method are based on the properties of this object, unless a GDI-compatible rendering mode was specified.

param.name: blendGamma
param.para: Type: FLOAT* When this method returns, contains the gamma value to use for gamma correction.

param.name: blendEnhancedContrast
param.para: Type: FLOAT* When this method returns, contains the enhanced contrast value to be used for blending.

param.name: blendClearTypeLevel
param.para: Type: FLOAT* When this method returns, contains the ClearType level used in the alpha blending.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteInlineObject.Draw(System.Void*,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextRenderer,System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL,System.Object)
member.summary: The application implemented rendering callback (IDWriteTextRenderer::DrawInlineObject) can use this to draw the inline object without needing to cast or query the object type. The text layout does not call this method directly.

param.name: clientDrawingContext
param.para: Type: void* The drawing context passed to IDWriteTextLayout::Draw. This parameter may be NULL.

param.name: renderer
param.para: Type: IDWriteTextRenderer* The same renderer passed to IDWriteTextLayout::Draw as the object's containing parent. This is useful if the inline object is recursive such as a nested layout.

param.name: originX
param.para: Type: FLOAT The x-coordinate at the upper-left corner of the inline object.

param.name: originY
param.para: Type: FLOAT The y-coordinate at the upper-left corner of the inline object.

param.name: isSideways
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag that indicates whether the object's baseline runs alongside the baseline axis of the line.

param.name: isRightToLeft
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag that indicates whether the object is in a right-to-left context and should be drawn flipped.

param.name: clientDrawingEffect
param.para: Type: IUnknown* The drawing effect set in IDWriteTextLayout::SetDrawingEffect. Usually this effect is a foreground brush that is used in glyph drawing.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteInlineObject.GetMetrics(Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_INLINE_OBJECT_METRICS*)
member.summary: IDWriteTextLayout calls this callback function to get the measurement of the inline object.

param.name: metrics
param.para: Type: DWRITE_INLINE_OBJECT_METRICS* When this method returns, contains a structure describing the geometric measurement of an application-defined inline object. These metrics are in relation to the baseline of the adjacent text.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteInlineObject.GetOverhangMetrics(Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_OVERHANG_METRICS*)
member.summary: IDWriteTextLayout calls this callback function to get the visible extents (in DIPs) of the inline object. In the case of a simple bitmap, with no padding and no overhang, all the overhangs will simply be zeroes.

param.name: overhangs
param.para: Type: DWRITE_OVERHANG_METRICS* Overshoot of visible extents (in DIPs) outside the object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteInlineObject.GetBreakConditions(Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_BREAK_CONDITION*,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_BREAK_CONDITION*)
member.summary: Layout uses this to determine the line-breaking behavior of the inline object among the text.

param.name: breakConditionBefore
param.para: Type: DWRITE_BREAK_CONDITION* When this method returns, contains a value which indicates the line-breaking condition between the object and the content immediately preceding it.

param.name: breakConditionAfter
param.para: Type: DWRITE_BREAK_CONDITION* When this method returns, contains a value which indicates the line-breaking condition between the object and the content immediately following it.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Gets the number of language/string pairs.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteLocalizedStrings.FindLocaleName(Windows.Win32.Foundation.PCWSTR,System.UInt32*,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL*)
member.summary: Gets the zero-based index of the locale name/string pair with the specified locale name.

param.name: localeName
param.para: Type: const WCHAR* A null-terminated array of characters containing the locale name to look for.

param.name: index
param.para: Type: UINT32* The zero-based index of the locale name/string pair. This method initializes index to UINT_MAX.

param.name: exists
param.para: Type: BOOL* When this method returns, contains TRUE if the locale name exists; otherwise, FALSE. This method initializes exists to FALSE.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If the specified locale name does not exist, the return value is S_OK, but index is UINT_MAX and exists is FALSE.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteLocalizedStrings.GetLocaleNameLength(System.UInt32,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: Gets the length in characters (not including the null terminator) of the locale name with the specified index.

param.name: index
param.para: Type: UINT32 Zero-based index of the locale name to be retrieved.

param.name: length
param.para: Type: UINT32* When this method returns, contains the length in characters of the locale name, not including the null terminator.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteLocalizedStrings.GetLocaleName(System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Foundation.PWSTR,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Copies the locale name with the specified index to the specified array.

param.name: index
param.para: Type: UINT32 Zero-based index of the locale name to be retrieved.

param.name: localeName
param.para: Type: WCHAR* When this method returns, contains a character array, which is null-terminated, that receives the locale name from the language/string pair. The buffer allocated for this array must be at least the size of size, in element count.

param.name: size
param.para: Type: UINT32 The size of the array in characters. The size must include space for the terminating null character.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteLocalizedStrings.GetStringLength(System.UInt32,System.UInt32*)

param.name: index
param.para: Type: UINT32 A zero-based index of the language/string pair.

param.name: length
param.para: Type: UINT32* The length in characters of the string, not including the null terminator, from the language/string pair.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteLocalizedStrings.GetString(System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Foundation.PWSTR,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Copies the string with the specified index to the specified array.

param.name: index
param.para: Type: UINT32 The zero-based index of the language/string pair to be examined.

param.name: stringBuffer
param.para: Type: WCHAR* The null terminated array of characters that receives the string from the language/string pair. The buffer allocated for this array should be at least the size of size. GetStringLength can be used to get the size of the array before using this method.

param.name: size
param.para: Type: UINT32 The size of the array in characters. The size must include space for the terminating null character. GetStringLength can be used to get the size of the array before using this method.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextAnalysisSink.SetScriptAnalysis(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_SCRIPT_ANALYSIS*)
member.summary: Reports script analysis for the specified text range.

param.name: textPosition
param.para: Type: UINT32 The starting position from which to report.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of UTF16 units of the reported range.

param.name: scriptAnalysis
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_SCRIPT_ANALYSIS* A pointer to a structure that contains a zero-based index representation of a writing system script and a value indicating whether additional shaping of text is required.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT A successful code or error code to stop analysis.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextAnalysisSink.SetLineBreakpoints(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_LINE_BREAKPOINT*)
member.summary: Sets line-break opportunities for each character, starting from the specified position.

param.name: textPosition
param.para: Type: UINT32 The starting text position from which to report.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of UTF16 units of the reported range.

param.name: lineBreakpoints
param.para: Type: DWRITE_LINE_BREAKPOINT* A pointer to a structure that contains breaking conditions set for each character from the starting position to the end of the specified range.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT A successful code or error code to stop analysis.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextAnalysisSink.SetBidiLevel(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets a bidirectional level on the range, which is called once per run change (either explicit or resolved implicit).

param.name: textPosition
param.para: Type: UINT32 The starting position from which to report.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of UTF16 units of the reported range.

param.name: explicitLevel
param.para: Type: UINT8 The explicit level from the paragraph reading direction and any embedded control codes RLE/RLO/LRE/LRO/PDF, which is determined before any additional rules.

param.name: resolvedLevel
param.para: Type: UINT8 The final implicit level considering the explicit level and characters' natural directionality, after all Bidi rules have been applied.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT A successful code or error code to stop analysis.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextAnalysisSink.SetNumberSubstitution(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteNumberSubstitution)
member.summary: Sets the number substitution on the text range affected by the text analysis.

param.name: textPosition
param.para: Type: UINT32 The starting position from which to report.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of UTF16 units of the reported range.

param.name: numberSubstitution
param.para: Type: IDWriteNumberSubstitution* An object that holds the appropriate digits and numeric punctuation for a given locale. Use IDWriteFactory::CreateNumberSubstitution to create this object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextAnalysisSource.GetTextAtPosition(System.UInt32,System.UInt16**,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: Gets a block of text starting at the specified text position.

param.name: textPosition
param.para: Type: UINT32 The first position of the piece to obtain. All positions are in UTF16 code units, not whole characters, which matters when supplementary characters are used.

param.name: textString
param.para: Type: const WCHAR** When this method returns, contains an address of the block of text as an array of characters to be retrieved from the text analysis.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32* When this method returns, contains the number of UTF16 units of the retrieved chunk. The returned length is not the length of the block, but the length remaining in the block, from the specified position until its end. For example, querying for a position that is 75 positions into a 100-position block would return 25.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextAnalysisSource.GetTextBeforePosition(System.UInt32,System.UInt16**,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: Gets a block of text immediately preceding the specified position.

param.name: textPosition
param.para: Type: UINT32 The position immediately after the last position of the block of text to obtain.

param.name: textString
param.para: Type: const WCHAR** When this method returns, contains an address of a pointer to the block of text, as an array of characters from the specified range. The text range will be from textPosition to the front of the block.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32* Number of UTF16 units of the retrieved block. The length returned is from the specified position to the front of the block.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.
