member.summary: Parses the input text string and maps it to the set of glyphs and associated glyph data according to the font and the writing system's rendering rules.

param.name: textString
param.para: Type: const WCHAR* An array of characters to convert to glyphs.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32 The length of textString.

param.name: fontFace
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontFace* The font face that is the source of the output glyphs.

param.name: isSideways
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag set to TRUE if the text is intended to be drawn vertically.

param.name: isRightToLeft
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag set to TRUE for right-to-left text.

param.name: scriptAnalysis
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_SCRIPT_ANALYSIS* A pointer to a Script analysis result from an AnalyzeScript call.

param.name: localeName
param.para: Type: const WCHAR* The locale to use when selecting glyphs. For example the same character may map to different glyphs for ja-jp versus zh-chs. If this is NULL, then the default mapping based on the script is used.

param.name: numberSubstitution
param.para: Type: IDWriteNumberSubstitution* A pointer to an optional number substitution which selects the appropriate glyphs for digits and related numeric characters, depending on the results obtained from AnalyzeNumberSubstitution. Passing NULL indicates that no substitution is needed and that the digits should receive nominal glyphs.

param.name: features
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_TYPOGRAPHIC_FEATURES** An array of pointers to the sets of typographic features to use in each feature range.

param.name: featureRangeLengths
param.para: Type: const UINT32* The length of each feature range, in characters. The sum of all lengths should be equal to textLength.

param.name: featureRanges
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of feature ranges.

param.name: maxGlyphCount
param.para: Type: UINT32 The maximum number of glyphs that can be returned.

param.name: clusterMap
param.para: Type: UINT16* When this method returns, contains the mapping from character ranges to glyph ranges.

param.name: textProps
param.para: Type: DWRITE_SHAPING_TEXT_PROPERTIES* When this method returns, contains a pointer to an array of structures that contains shaping properties for each character.

param.name: glyphIndices
param.para: Type: UINT16* The output glyph indices.

param.name: glyphProps
param.para: Type: DWRITE_SHAPING_GLYPH_PROPERTIES* When this method returns, contains a pointer to an array of structures that contain shaping properties for each output glyph.

param.name: actualGlyphCount
param.para: Type: UINT32* When this method returns, contains the actual number of glyphs returned if the call succeeds.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Places glyphs output from the GetGlyphs method according to the font and the writing system's rendering rules.

param.name: textString
param.para: Type: const WCHAR* An array of characters containing the original string from which the glyphs came.

param.name: clusterMap
param.para: Type: const UINT16* A pointer to the mapping from character ranges to glyph ranges. This is returned by GetGlyphs.

param.name: textProps
param.para: Type: DWRITE_SHAPING_TEXT_PROPERTIES* A pointer to an array of structures that contains shaping properties for each character. This structure is returned by GetGlyphs.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32 The text length of textString.

param.name: glyphIndices
param.para: Type: const UINT16* An array of glyph indices returned by GetGlyphs.

param.name: glyphProps
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_SHAPING_GLYPH_PROPERTIES* A pointer to an array of structures that contain shaping properties for each glyph returned by GetGlyphs.

param.name: glyphCount
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of glyphs returned from GetGlyphs.

param.name: fontFace
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontFace* A pointer to the font face that is the source for the output glyphs.

param.name: fontEmSize
param.para: Type: FLOAT The logical font size in DIPs.

param.name: isSideways
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag set to TRUE if the text is intended to be drawn vertically.

param.name: isRightToLeft
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag set to TRUE for right-to-left text.

param.name: scriptAnalysis
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_SCRIPT_ANALYSIS* A pointer to a Script analysis result from an AnalyzeScript call.

param.name: localeName
param.para: Type: const WCHAR* An array of characters containing the locale to use when selecting glyphs. For example, the same character may map to different glyphs for ja-jp versus zh-chs. If this is NULL, the default mapping based on the script is used.

param.name: features
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_TYPOGRAPHIC_FEATURES** An array of pointers to the sets of typographic features to use in each feature range.

param.name: featureRangeLengths
param.para: Type: const UINT32* The length of each feature range, in characters. The sum of all lengths should be equal to textLength.

param.name: featureRanges
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of feature ranges.

param.name: glyphAdvances
param.para: Type: FLOAT* When this method returns, contains the advance width of each glyph.

param.name: glyphOffsets
param.para: Type: DWRITE_GLYPH_OFFSET* When this method returns, contains the offset of the origin of each glyph.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.summary: Place glyphs output from the GetGlyphs method according to the font and the writing system's rendering rules.

param.name: textString
param.para: Type: const WCHAR* An array of characters containing the original string from which the glyphs came.

param.name: clusterMap
param.para: Type: const UINT16* A pointer to the mapping from character ranges to glyph ranges. This is returned by GetGlyphs.

param.name: textProps
param.para: Type: DWRITE_SHAPING_TEXT_PROPERTIES* A pointer to an array of structures that contains shaping properties for each character. This structure is returned by GetGlyphs.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32 The text length of textString.

param.name: glyphIndices
param.para: Type: const UINT16* An array of glyph indices returned by GetGlyphs.

param.name: glyphProps
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_SHAPING_GLYPH_PROPERTIES* A pointer to an array of structures that contain shaping properties for each glyph returned by GetGlyphs.

param.name: glyphCount
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of glyphs returned from GetGlyphs.

param.name: fontFace
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontFace* A pointer to the font face that is the source for the output glyphs.

param.name: fontEmSize
param.para: Type: FLOAT The logical font size in DIPs.

param.name: pixelsPerDip
param.para: Type: FLOAT The number of physical pixels per DIP.

param.name: transform
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_MATRIX* An optional transform applied to the glyphs and their positions. This transform is applied after the scaling specified by the font size and pixelsPerDip.

param.name: useGdiNatural
param.para: Type: BOOL When set to FALSE, the metrics are the same as the metrics of GDI aliased text. When set to TRUE, the metrics are the same as the metrics of text measured by GDI using a font created with CLEARTYPE_NATURAL_QUALITY.

param.name: isSideways
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag set to TRUE if the text is intended to be drawn vertically.

param.name: isRightToLeft
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag set to TRUE for right-to-left text.

param.name: scriptAnalysis
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_SCRIPT_ANALYSIS* A pointer to a Script analysis result from anAnalyzeScript call.

param.name: localeName
param.para: Type: const WCHAR* An array of characters containing the locale to use when selecting glyphs. For example, the same character may map to different glyphs for ja-jp versus zh-chs. If this is NULL, then the default mapping based on the script is used.

param.name: features
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_TYPOGRAPHIC_FEATURES** An array of pointers to the sets of typographic features to use in each feature range.

param.name: featureRangeLengths
param.para: Type: const UINT32* The length of each feature range, in characters. The sum of all lengths should be equal to textLength.

param.name: featureRanges
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of feature ranges.

param.name: glyphAdvances
param.para: Type: FLOAT* When this method returns, contains the advance width of each glyph.

param.name: glyphOffsets
param.para: Type: DWRITE_GLYPH_OFFSET* When this method returns, contains the offset of the origin of each glyph.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

param.para: Type: UINT32 The position of the text to inspect.

param.name: fontCollection
param.para: Type: IDWriteFontCollection** Contains an address of a pointer to the current font collection.

param.para: Type: DWRITE_TEXT_RANGE* The range of text that has the same formatting as the text at the position specified by currentPosition. This means the run has the exact formatting as the position specified, including but not limited to the underline.

param.para: Type: DWRITE_OVERHANG_METRICS* Overshoots of visible extents (in DIPs) outside the layout.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextLayout.GetClusterMetrics(Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_CLUSTER_METRICS*,System.UInt32,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: Retrieves logical properties and measurements of each glyph cluster.

param.name: clusterMetrics
param.para: Type: DWRITE_CLUSTER_METRICS* When this method returns, contains metrics, such as line-break or total advance width, for a glyph cluster.

param.name: maxClusterCount
param.para: Type: UINT32 The maximum size of the clusterMetrics array.

param.name: actualClusterCount
param.para: Type: UINT32* When this method returns, contains the actual size of the clusterMetrics array that is needed.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextLayout.DetermineMinWidth(System.Single*)
member.summary: Determines the minimum possible width the layout can be set to without emergency breaking between the characters of whole words occurring.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextLayout.HitTestPoint(System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL*,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL*,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_HIT_TEST_METRICS*)
member.summary: The application calls this function passing in a specific pixel location relative to the top-left location of the layout box and obtains the information about the correspondent hit-test metrics of the text string where the hit-test has occurred.

param.name: pointX
param.para: Type: FLOAT The pixel location X to hit-test, relative to the top-left location of the layout box.

param.name: pointY
param.para: Type: FLOAT The pixel location Y to hit-test, relative to the top-left location of the layout box.

param.name: isTrailingHit
param.para: Type: BOOL* An output flag that indicates whether the hit-test location is at the leading or the trailing side of the character. When the output *isInside value is set to FALSE, this value is set according to the output hitTestMetrics->textPosition value to represent the edge closest to the hit-test location.

param.name: isInside
param.para: Type: BOOL* An output flag that indicates whether the hit-test location is inside the text string. When FALSE, the position nearest the text's edge is returned.

param.name: hitTestMetrics
param.para: Type: DWRITE_HIT_TEST_METRICS* The output geometry fully enclosing the hit-test location. When the output *isInside value is set to FALSE, this structure represents the geometry enclosing the edge closest to the hit-test location.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextLayout.HitTestTextPosition(System.UInt32,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL,System.Single*,System.Single*,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_HIT_TEST_METRICS*)
member.summary: The application calls this function to get the pixel location relative to the top-left of the layout box given the text position and the logical side of the position.

param.name: textPosition
param.para: Type: UINT32 The text position used to get the pixel location.

param.name: isTrailingHit
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag that indicates whether the pixel location is of the leading or the trailing side of the specified text position.

param.name: pointX
param.para: Type: FLOAT* When this method returns, contains the output pixel location X, relative to the top-left location of the layout box.

param.name: pointY
param.para: Type: FLOAT* When this method returns, contains the output pixel location Y, relative to the top-left location of the layout box.

param.name: hitTestMetrics
param.para: Type: DWRITE_HIT_TEST_METRICS* When this method returns, contains the output geometry fully enclosing the specified text position.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextLayout.HitTestTextRange(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_HIT_TEST_METRICS*,System.UInt32,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: The application calls this function to get a set of hit-test metrics corresponding to a range of text positions. One of the main usages is to implement highlight selection of the text string.

param.name: textPosition
param.para: Type: UINT32 The first text position of the specified range.

param.name: textLength
param.para: Type: UINT32 The number of positions of the specified range.

param.name: originX
param.para: Type: FLOAT The origin pixel location X at the left of the layout box. This offset is added to the hit-test metrics returned.

param.name: originY
param.para: Type: FLOAT The origin pixel location Y at the top of the layout box. This offset is added to the hit-test metrics returned.

param.name: hitTestMetrics
param.para: Type: DWRITE_HIT_TEST_METRICS* When this method returns, contains a pointer to a buffer of the output geometry fully enclosing the specified position range. The buffer must be at least as large as maxHitTestMetricsCount.

param.name: maxHitTestMetricsCount
param.para: Type: UINT32 Maximum number of boxes hitTestMetrics could hold in its buffer memory.

param.name: actualHitTestMetricsCount
param.para: Type: UINT32* Actual number of geometries hitTestMetrics holds in its buffer memory.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextRenderer.DrawGlyphRun(System.Void*,System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_GLYPH_RUN@,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_GLYPH_RUN_DESCRIPTION*,System.Object)
member.summary: IDWriteTextLayout::Draw calls this function to instruct the client to render a run of glyphs.

param.name: clientDrawingContext
param.para: Type: void* The application-defined drawing context passed to IDWriteTextLayout::Draw.

param.name: baselineOriginX
param.para: Type: FLOAT The pixel location (X-coordinate) at the baseline origin of the glyph run.

param.name: baselineOriginY
param.para: Type: FLOAT The pixel location (Y-coordinate) at the baseline origin of the glyph run.

param.name: measuringMode
param.para: Type: DWRITE_MEASURING_MODE The measuring method for glyphs in the run, used with the other properties to determine the rendering mode.

param.name: glyphRun
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_GLYPH_RUN* Pointer to the glyph run instance to render.

param.name: glyphRunDescription
param.para: Type: const DWRITE_GLYPH_RUN_DESCRIPTION* A pointer to the glyph run description instance which contains properties of the characters associated with this run.

param.name: clientDrawingEffect
param.para: Type: IUnknown* Application-defined drawing effects for the glyphs to render. Usually this argument represents effects such as the foreground brush filling the interior of text.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextRenderer.DrawUnderline(System.Void*,System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.DWRITE_UNDERLINE*,System.Object)

param.name: clientDrawingEffect

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteTextRenderer.DrawInlineObject(System.Void*,System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Win32.Graphics.DirectWrite.IDWriteInlineObject,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL,Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOL,System.Object)
member.summary: IDWriteTextLayout::Draw calls this application callback when it needs to draw an inline object.

param.name: clientDrawingContext
param.para: Type: void* The application-defined drawing context passed to IDWriteTextLayout::Draw.

param.name: originX
param.para: Type: FLOAT X-coordinate at the top-left corner of the inline object.

param.name: originY
param.para: Type: FLOAT Y-coordinate at the top-left corner of the inline object.

param.name: inlineObject
param.para: Type: IDWriteInlineObject* The application-defined inline object set using IDWriteTextFormat::SetInlineObject.

param.name: isSideways
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag that indicates whether the object's baseline runs alongside the baseline axis of the line.

param.name: isRightToLeft
param.para: Type: BOOL A Boolean flag that indicates whether the object is in a right-to-left context, hinting that the drawing may want to mirror the normal image.

param.name: clientDrawingEffect
param.para: Type: IUnknown* Application-defined drawing effects for the glyphs to render. Usually this argument represents effects such as the foreground brush filling the interior of a line.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.EnumFontFamiliesEx(Windows.Win32.Graphics.Gdi.HDC,Windows.Win32.Graphics.Gdi.LOGFONTW*,Windows.Win32.Graphics.Gdi.FONTENUMPROCW,Windows.Win32.Foundation.LPARAM,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The EnumFontFamiliesEx function enumerates all uniquely-named fonts in the system that match the font characteristics specified by the LOGFONT structure. EnumFontFamiliesEx enumerates fonts based on typeface name, character set, or both.
member.param: A handle to the device context from which to enumerate the fonts.

param.name: lpLogfont
param.para: A pointer to a LOGFONT structure that contains information about the fonts to enumerate. The function examines the following members.

member.param: A pointer to the application defined callback function. For more information, see the EnumFontFamExProc function.
An application defined value. The function passes this value to the callback function along with font information.
This parameter is not used and must be zero.
member.returns: The return value is the last value returned by the callback function. This value depends on which font families are available for the specified device.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.DeleteDC(Windows.Win32.Graphics.Gdi.CreatedHDC)
member.summary: The DeleteDC function deletes the specified device context (DC).
member.param: A handle to the device context.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.CreateCompatibleDC(Windows.Win32.Graphics.Gdi.HDC)
member.summary: The CreateCompatibleDC function creates a memory device context (DC) compatible with the specified device.
member.param: A handle to an existing DC. If this handle is NULL, the function creates a memory DC compatible with the application's current screen.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to a memory DC. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.ReleaseDC(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND,Windows.Win32.Graphics.Gdi.HDC)
member.summary: The ReleaseDC function releases a device context (DC), freeing it for use by other applications. The effect of the ReleaseDC function depends on the type of DC. It frees only common and window DCs. It has no effect on class or private DCs.
member.param: A handle to the window whose DC is to be released.
A handle to the DC to be released.

returns.para: The return value indicates whether the DC was released. If the DC was released, the return value is 1. If the DC was not released, the return value is zero.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.GetDC(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND)
member.summary: The GetDC function retrieves a handle to a device context (DC) for the client area of a specified window or for the entire screen.
member.param: A handle to the window whose DC is to be retrieved. If this value is NULL, GetDC retrieves the DC for the entire screen.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the DC for the specified window's client area. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.
